alert.note: Alert for Benton; Carroll; Madison; Washington (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 17 at 12:18PM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Arkansas, including the following counties, Benton, Carroll, Madison and Washington. * WHEN...Until 415 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1217 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fayetteville... Springdale... Berryville... Huntsville... Eureka Springs... Farmington... Prairie Grove... Green Forest... Elkins... Tontitown... Bethel Heights... West Fork... Lincoln... Greenland... Hindsville... Wesley... Hobbs State Park... War Eagle... Clifty... Withrow Springs State Park... - This includes the following highways... Interstate 49 between mile markers 47 and 74. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
